posts.title: I don't care how big of a tantrum Elon throws, I'm not budging.
posts.content:
I've seen both illegal and legal H1b immigration wreck this country. I don't want to hear any BS leftist arguments about MAGA being the bad guy because we won't roll over to globalist demands. F the globalists and all of their wishes.

I also don't want to hear about those of us who put Americans first being shills or extremists. BS. We voted Trump in office with a CLEAR Americans first mandate. Those riding on Trump's coattails had better wise up to that fact, fast.

NO ONE should immigrate to the US unless they can demonstrate that they will increase the standard of living for everyone here, not just themselves.

Elon, you kicked a hornet's nest and now you are getting stung. Take it as a learning opportunity.

Pease out.

posts.title: My White Male Tech Story
posts.content:
Certified lurker here. But this latest H1B news has made me want to share my story.

I, a white American male, decided I wanted to become a game developer back in 8th grade. Didn’t know the first thing about programming, but had one of those TI-84 calculators. Made many games and other programs on the calc and by the end of high school had it rendering 3D graphics. All self taught.

Went to college for comp sci and excelled in every cisc class. Found the classes a little lacking and continued my self education.

Graduated and began career searching. In the mean time I taught myself Unreal Engine. Ended up building a full (albeit small) game. But doing that all alone is difficult and I shifted focus to beginning a more generic, non game focused, tech career, just to try and get my foot in the door.

Fast forward 2 years and over 1000 applications, many resume revisions, networkings, and I've received exactly 1 interview which fell through despite having "the perfect answer" on the technical interview. Even my close friend who actually has a job in tech (He's Asian btw) cannot understand why no one will even talk to me. At this point I'm convinced it's because I'm the wrong demographic.

And then after seeing some of the things Elon and Vivek say about me not being "motivated" enough or "intelligent" enough, I have to HARD disagree. In fact, it F-ing pisses me off that they would suggest such a thing. Especially hearing so many similar stories. That's why I decided to share mine. I am one of many it seems, and something needs to be done about this blatant discrimination.

Even my close friend who actually has a job in tech (He's Asian btw) cannot understand why no one will even talk to me. At this point I'm convinced it's because I'm the wrong demographic.

posts.title: My White Male Tech Story
posts.content:
Certified lurker here. But this latest H1B news has made me want to share my story.

I, a white American male, decided I wanted to become a game developer back in 8th grade. Didn’t know the first thing about programming, but had one of those TI-84 calculators. Made many games and other programs on the calc and by the end of high school had it rendering 3D graphics. All self taught.

Went to college for comp sci and excelled in every cisc class. Found the classes a little lacking and continued my self education.

Graduated and began career searching. In the mean time I taught myself Unreal Engine. Ended up building a full (albeit small) game. But doing that all alone is difficult and I shifted focus to beginning a more generic, non game focused, tech career, just to try and get my foot in the door.

Fast forward 2 years and over 1000 applications, many resume revisions, networkings, and I've received exactly 1 interview which fell through despite having "the perfect answer" on the technical interview. Even my close friend who actually has a job in tech (He's Asian btw) cannot understand why no one will even talk to me. At this point I'm convinced it's because I'm the wrong demographic.

And then after seeing some of the things Elon and Vivek say about me not being "motivated" enough or "intelligent" enough, I have to HARD disagree. In fact, it F-ing pisses me off that they would suggest such a thing. Especially hearing so many similar stories. That's why I decided to share mine. I am one of many it seems, and something needs to be done about this blatant discrimination.

Certified lurker here.  But this latest H1B news has made me want to share my story.

I, a white American male, decided I wanted to become a game developer back in 8th grade. Didn’t know the first thing about programming, but had one of those TI-84 calculators. Made many games and other programs on the calc and by the end of high school had it rendering 3D graphics. All self taught.

Went to college for comp sci and excelled in every cisc class. Found the classes a little lacking and continued my self education.

Graduated and began career searching. In the mean time I taught myself Unreal Engine.  Ended up building a full (albeit small) game.  But doing that all alone is difficult and I shifted focus to beginning a more generic, non game focused, tech career, just to try and get my foot in the door.

Fast forward 2 years and over 1000 applications, many resume revisions, networkings, and I've received exactly 1 interview which fell through despite having "the perfect answer" on the technical interview.  Even my close friend who actually has a job in tech (He's Asian btw) cannot understand why no one will even talk to me. At this point I'm convinced it's because I'm the wrong demographic.

And then after seeing some of the things Elon and Vivek say about me not being "motivated" enough or "intelligent" enough, I have to HARD disagree. In fact, it F-ing pisses me off that they would suggest such a thing. Especially hearing so many similar stories.  That's why I decided to share mine.  I am one of many it seems, and something needs to be done about this blatant discrimination.
